1.heading: Family.
1.title: Batman : Family.
1.author: [No author]
notes: Cover title: Batman Family.
Complete in 8 nos.

2.heading: Family.
2.title: The Horned Toad
2.author: original story by Gerald W
2.appears_in: Haslam ; illustrated adaptation by Garth Haslam.
notes: (Illustrated Editions ; no. 1)
Summary (from OCLC): A young boy learns a lesson of the importance of family and loved ones through his relationship with his grandmother, her death and that of a horned toad.

4.title: Family. "Now That You're Here You're Family Too, Ronnie"
4.author: Francesco Marciuliano & Mike Manley.
notes: Summary: The family settles in for difficult times and "some bizarre narrative turns."

5.heading: Family.
5.title: "Parent as a Verb : Quarantine Edition"
5.author: Emily Flake
5.appears_in: p. 21 in The New Yorker, v. 96, no. 7 (Apr. 6, 2020).
notes: A strip about family and the coronavirus pandemic.
Begins: "Let's get one thing straight right off the bat."
Title from contents page.

6.heading: Family.
6.title: Pop at His Best

Pop is "Britain's premier family strip."

32.title: The Family Circle
32.author: by Rolf Gerdau
32.appears_in: p. 47-49 in Comic Book Marketplace, v. 2, no. 60 (June 1998).
notes: (Fandom Flashbacks)

Introduces and reprints an article from The Family Circle, v. 20, no. 16 (Apr. 17, 1942): "Are the Comics Bad for Children?" by H. Dyson Carter. Includes sidebars: "Sticking by Superman," an editorial from the Burlington (Vermont) Daily News, and "The Superman Legend" by C. Bowie Millican.

169.heading: The Family Circus--Miscellanea.
169.title: "Comics Offer a Forum for Issues of Our Times"
169.author: by Shelvia Dancy
169.appears_in: Religion News Service article in The Plain Dealer (Cleveland, Ohio), May 23, 2001.
notes: Based on interviews with Leonard Greenspoon of Creighton University, Lucy Caswell of Ohio State University, and Mike Morgan, creator of the strip "For Heaven's Sake!". Mentions religious themes and clergy in B.C., Beetle Bailey, Kudzu, The Family Circus, Frank and Ernest, and Peanuts.

170.heading: The Family Circus--Miscellanea.
170.title: "Deja Viewed" p. 47-51 in Hogan's Alley, no. 9
170.author: [No author]
notes: Paired similar drawings involving Brother Juniper, 9 Chickweed Lane, The Norm, Foxtrot, Pat Oliphant, H. Payne, Baby Blues, Get Fuzzy, La Patrouille Perdue, Frontline Combat, Two-Fisted Tales. Thor, The Family Circus, Peanuts, Big Nate, Beetle Bailey, and Zits.
